questions.question: What is the primary purpose of unit testing?
answers: To test individual units of code in isolation
To test the application as a whole
To ensure each part of the code functions as expected

questions.question: Which of the following are benefits of unit testing?
answers: Reduces the number of lines of code

questions.question: Which of the following are popular unit testing frameworks for Java?
Which annotation is used to indicate a test method in JUnit 5?
What does the @BeforeEach annotation do?
answers: Runs a method before all tests in the class
Runs a method before each test in the class
Runs a method after each test in the class
Runs a method after all tests in the class

questions.question: What are some common assertions in JUnit 5?
How can you run JUnit tests with Maven?
What does the @ParameterizedTest annotation do?
answers: Indicates a test that can run with multiple input values
Allows running a test with different scenarios
Indicates a test that should be ignored
Indicates a test that runs after all other tests

questions.question: Which of the following are features of JUnit 5?
Which assertion checks if two values are equal?
What is the purpose of the JUnit Vintage component?
answers: To provide backward compatibility for JUnit 3 and 4 tests
To introduce new annotations for testing

questions.question: Which of the following annotations run once before all tests in the class?
